div.p: UM312 1873/13, Registrar's correspondence, University of Melbourne Archives, Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: To proof. Date is worked out by working back from the date in last f/n.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: 23rd May 1873 has been written at the top of the letter in an unknown hand, but this is evidently the date it was received at the University Registrar's Office, since the information in Barry's annotation indicates that the Friday on which the letter was written must have been 16 May.

div.p:
The very few men, left me in the Garden, dear Sir Redmond, are required to clear up a little for the Queensbirthday & Sunday. But so far as my ruinously reduced means will admit of it (we cannot even keep down the weeds) your application for plants again shall have my attention any early morning hour next week. I trust that this time my help after so many years
any idea how many years?
will be for the benefit of my Department publicly acknowledged.
See also M to R. Barry, 29 April 1873.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller
MS annotation by R. Barry on 22 May: 'To the Registrar Please order Elliott to make his arrangements to call on Dr Mueller on Tuesday next May 27. with a cart at 9 AM'.
